Module paths
Package edu.ntnu.idatt2001.paths.controllers

Class MainGameController

java.lang.Object
edu.ntnu.idatt2001.paths.controllers.MainGameController
public class MainGameController extends Object
The type Main game controller. This class is responsible for the main game view. It is used to show the user the current passage, and to handle the user's actions.
Version:
1.0 21.05.2023
Author:
Helle R. and Sander S.

  • Method Details

    • setup

      public void setup()
      Sets up the game. This method is called when the game is started.

    • createMouseClickedEventHandler

      public static javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> createMouseClickedEventHandler(javafx.scene.text.TextFlow textFlow, javafx.scene.control.TextArea passageContent)
      Create mouse clicked event handler event handler. This method is used to handle the user's mouse clicks. It is used to skip the text animation.
      Parameters:
      textFlow - the text flow that is being clicked
      passageContent - the passage content that is being clicked
      Returns:
      the event handler that handles the mouse click

    • executeActions

      public void executeActions(Link link)
      Execute actions. This method is used to execute the actions that the link has. It is called when the user clicks on a link.
      Parameters:
      link - the link that is being clicked

    • minigameCheck

      public boolean minigameCheck()
      Minigame check boolean. This method is used to check if the player has to play a minigame. It is called when the player clicks on a link. It has a 10% chance of returning true. If it returns true, the player has to play a minigame.
      Returns:
      the boolean that indicates if the player has to play a minigame

    • createInventoryBox

      public javafx.scene.layout.HBox createInventoryBox()
      Create the inventory box. This method is used to create the inventory box. It stores the items that the player has.
      Returns:
      the HBox that contains the inventory

    • createExitButton

      public javafx.scene.control.Button createExitButton()
      Create exit button button. This method is used to create the exit button. It is used to exit the game.
      Returns:
      the button that exits the game

    • createHelpButton

      public javafx.scene.control.Button createHelpButton()
      Create help button button. This method is used to create the help button. It is used to show the help text.
      Returns:
      the button that shows the help text

    • createHomeButton

      public javafx.scene.control.Button createHomeButton(ScreenController screenController)
      Create home button button. This method is used to create the home button. It is used to go back to the home screen.
      Parameters:
      screenController - the screen controller that is used to switch screens
      Returns:
      the button that goes back to the home screen

    • createRestartButton

      public javafx.scene.control.Button createRestartButton(javafx.scene.text.TextFlow textFlow)
      Create restart button button. This method is used to create the restart button. It is used to restart the game.
      Parameters:
      textFlow - the text flow that is used to show the text
      Returns:
      the button that restarts the game

    • createHealthBar

      public javafx.scene.control.ProgressBar createHealthBar()
      Create health bar progress bar. This method is used to create the health bar. It is used to show the health of the player. The color of the health bar changes depending on the health of the player.
      Returns:
      the progress bar that shows the health of the player

    • createLabel

      public javafx.scene.control.Label createLabel(String text, String type)
      Create label label. This method is used to create a label. It is used to show the health, score and gold of the player.
      Parameters:
      text - the text that is shown on the label
      type - the type of the label
      Returns:
      the label that shows the health, score and gold of the player

    • setupGoals

      public javafx.scene.layout.VBox setupGoals()
      Setup goals v box. This method is used to setup the goals. It is used to show the goals of the game.
      Returns:
      the goals v box

    • setupCurrentPassage

      public String setupCurrentPassage()
      This method is used to set the current passage.
      Returns:
      the current passage as a string

    • getCurrentPassage

      public Passage getCurrentPassage()
      Gets current passage. This method is used to get the current passage.
      Returns:
      the current passage

    • getGame

      public Game getGame()
      Gets game. This method is used to get the game.
      Returns:
      the game that is played

    • resetGoals

      public static void resetGoals()

    • go

      public void go(Link link, javafx.scene.text.TextFlow textFlow)
      Go. This method is used to go to the next passage. It is used to go to the next passage when a link is clicked. It also updates the UI with the next passage.
      Parameters:
      link - the link that is clicked
      textFlow - the text flow that is updated with the next passage
